post_job_title: Great People Trainee Program (GPTP) Batch XIII at Telkom Indonesia
post_description:
No one really talks about post graduate depression.

I landed my first job prior to graduating at 22, did I know what I was doing? Probably not, but what I knew was that the social stigma stated that I had to get a job asap in order to prove myself validation. It took some time to understand truly what I wanted to do and how I was going to do it, and so here I am 23 and now at my 3rd job.

It was late last year that my first job and I had to part ways, I knew that I wasn’t mentally prepared, and that I was still in a state of shock of how things are done at work. So, I decided then that I wanted to continue my studies since I knew that my bachelors weren’t enough to fulfil my thirst just yet.

Prepped for GRE for a good 3 months and started my application late in the game. Despite the late decision, my parents were supportive of me, whatever the decision may be. It wasn’t long until I sent in my last application to 5 universities. As I waited the verdict, I also started to apply for some jobs to fill up the time, just in case my shots were amiss.

I knew that my professional experience wasn’t enough yet, nor was I as fresh as a fresh graduate. The fear always manifested in me throughout the process of applying. Was I enough, did I make the wrong choices? I was truly burnt out.

As the days rolled by, I got called back for 4 job offers and got my admissions verdict of which 4 out of 5 of my applications were accepted, with an addition of one offering me a scholarship. Chosen as one out of the two awardees for The GREAT scholarship council sponsored by the UK government’s GREAT Britain Campaign and the British Council with participating institution, The University of Manchester.

After much thought, consideration and support, I chose to pass on my scholarship to the next candidate and decided to continue my career with Telkom Indonesia, a place where I know could help shape my creative spirit and cultivate a career that will surely bring opportunities ahead. 

My 5 cents? Know that the hustle culture isn’t for everyone, everyone’s bound to hit a bump in the road.  Everything will work out exactly the ways it’s supposed to. Change is inevitable, but growth is optional. So here to the fighters, know you’re worth more than just a simple pay check.

post_job_title: Contract Ended | Open for any employment | Banking and Management Graduate
post_description:
Good Day to everyone,

I hope you are reading this at the safety of your home, stay protected.

It's been a 7th month of unemployment and I am am still seeking for your assistance, connections, recommendations, advise and any help to get employment.

I am a Diploma in Banking and Higher Certificate in Management Graduate from University of Johannesburg and Milpark Business School (MBS) I am actively seeking for new job opportunity (permanent, contract, internship etc) to learn new skills, knowledge and experience while I add value, working with the rest of the team to achieve the organization objectives.

Please assist to obtain that job opportunity that matches with my profile but I am not limited to my educational background and work experience, I am open to any new opportunity and I'd appreciate your help.

Kindly check my profile and my CV is available upon request. Thank you for your time and consideration.

#PleaseGiveMeAChance
#PleaseNoticeMe

saya telah dipercayai menjadi pembicara pada seminar " Pelatihan Digital Marketing untuk Membuka Peluang Bisnis Mandiri". Peran saya di seminar tersebut sebagai content creator dari HadeGawe, yang kurang lebih bekerja 1 tahun pada bidang tersebut.

Seminar tersebut diadakan pada tanggal 13 Juni 2021 dengan keadaan daring ( dalam jaringan ), walaupun seminar diadakan secara daring para peserta tetap antusias untuk belajar bersama.

Terimakasih untuk Telkom University yang telah mempercayai saya untuk berbagi ilmu dengan orang - orang yang hebat dan terimakasih untuk HadeGawe yang telah memberikan kesempatan saya sebagai perwakilan untuk berbagi ilmu kepada orang banyak.

post_description:
My Journey as a Leader.

My journey started in 1st semester of college at Telkom University. I absolutely have no experience being a leader. In 1st semester, I participated in Gemastik 12 volunteer activities and only became a member. Then I tried for the first time to become a team leader in the competition in Program Kreativitas Mahasiswa (PKM) where I led 2 of my friends. I actively participate in competitions, so I often become a leader for trying.

Then that, at the end of 1st semester, I join to the event as a committee at Telkom Edutainment 2020. I became the Event Coordinator Division where I led 8 members. When I was the coordinator of the event division, I received a message from the Head of the Organization: "Selama berkuliah, selamat berproses". I don't know what 'proses' means. I was wondering to myself and looking for the meaning. At the end, I found the meaning. In my opinion, it is a process to improve one's abilities and value.

Long story short, in the 3rd semester. I actively participated in various organizations as a member, and I also observed how the head of the organization became a leader. In addition, I was also expected to observe the leader figure who was liked by the members. During the 3rd semester, I was also become Head of Event at Telkom Edutainment 2021 where I led 9 members.

After that, at the beginning of the 4th semester, I had the intention to reduce the organization was I joined because I was tired of joining the organization and thought I wanted to enjoy college like my friends who could hang out. But instead, I was trusted by the President of Proclub Telkom University, namely Alif Farhan, who was offered the responsibility to become a Lead Business Analyst. With various considerations, I accept it.

Over time, I learned many lessons from the leaders about how they handled the cases that occurred. Then recently at the end of semester 4, I was chosen and trusted by my friends in the Tentor Community HMSI organization to be the vice-chairman who has 13 members. And now in EDE Laboratory, I am also trusting as Assistant Coordinator where this organization has more staff and members.

This is challenging for me. I am currently active in 6 organizations, 3 of which are as a leader. Until now I still feel bad about being a leader and I still learning how to be the best leader.

#leadership #journey #leader

post_description:
The Healing Power Of Words Speaker Profile:-

Saul Molobi, a former South Africa’s Consul-General to Milan, is the CEO and Group Chairman of Brandhill Africa (Pty) Ltd. He’s touted as one of the foremost thought leaders on competitive identity and public diplomacy with experience in global marketing – in the areas of tourism, trade and investment promotion.

In 2020 he was nominated as the “CEO of the Year” by the US-based World CEO Rankings. On 15 July 2021 Brandhill Africa (Pty) Ltd was given the Brand Leadership Award by the World Branding Council. 

He has vast experience from diverse fields: private sector (having worked as Publishing Director at Heinemann Publishers); state-owned companies (Senior Manager: Corporate Communication at Telkom; General Manager: Marketing & Communications, Trade & Investment Limpopo; most recently as Group Executive: Trade, Investment and Regulatory Enablement, Gauteng Growth and Development Agency); public service (Chief Director: Marketing Communications, Department of Trade & Industry; General Manager: Provincial Communication Services, Limpopo's Office of the Premier; and Chief Director: Public Diplomacy, Department of International Relations & Cooperation); and the anti-apartheid NGO sector (Editor-in-Chief, Learn & Teach Publications; and Director, Independent Magazine Group).

He promotes trade and investment opportunities accruing from the AfCFTA through Jambo Africa Online weekly news portal and the Biashara Services & Products Africa (BiSPA) Conference & Exhibition.

He possesses an MSc in Global Marketing (University of Liverpool); MA and BA (Hons) in Dramatic Art from (University of the Witwatersrand); Post-Graduate Diploma from the IMM Graduate School of Marketing; and BA from University of Limpopo.

A prolific writer, poet and cultural activist, his latest book, “Sound and Fury: The Chronicles of Healing”, endeavours to mainstream issues affecting people with disabilities – the foreword to the book was written by Mr Kgalema Motlanthe, former President of the Republic of South Africa.

post_job_title: Digital Media Communication Student at Telkom University | Head of Aspiration at Dewan Perwakilan Mahasiswa FKB Telkom University
post_description:
Directorate of career development, alumni, and endowment (Dir. CAE) of Telkom University held a online career seminar with SCTV and Liputan 6

On July 3rd of 2020, I am getting new insight about "How to be a good Innovative Journalist in Revolution 4.0" 

Being a journalist is certainly not difficult, but it takes skills in news. A career in journalism has a broad and very interesting work perspective. 

There are 4 points of the type of journalistic profession that we must pursue

1. Creative Content, think and execute creative ideas for media content
2. Script Writer, creating informative and entertaining scripts for news programs
3. Editor In Chief, organizes and coordinates journalistic content in the media
4. Voice Over, provides an explanation of the news broadcast

Thanks to Djati Darma, Journalist of Liputan 6 SCTV as a presenter and Nadya Laras Ayu, Presenter at Liputan6.com (Telkom University Alumni class 2011). Also, Tel-U career as the organizer of the online career seminar how to be a good innovative journalist in revolution 4.0
#journalism #motivation #beneficial #career

post_job_title: Telkom University Career Development, Alumni & Endowment
post_description:
[ Telkom University Endowment Peduli ]

Pandemi Covid-19 masih belum berakhir!

Sampai saat ini jumlah kasus baru yang terkena Covid-19 semakin bertambah hingga mencapai angka lebih 2 juta kasus.

Tahukah Anda, disaat orang-orang mencoba menjaga diri dengan tidak keluar rumah dan menghindari kerumunan, ada saudara-saudara kita yang bekerja keras siang dan malam sebagai tenaga medis yang harus rela berjuang tanpa lelah untuk merawat para pasien? Tanpa mengindahkan keselamatan sendiri, para tenaga medis berusaha dengan sepenuh hati untuk membantu agar keadaan menjadi lebih baik.

Namun, dengan banyaknya kasus yang semakin meningkat, peralatan dan kebutuhan medis yang diperlukan pasien Covid-19 dan para tenaga medis juga semakin berkurang. Mereka saat ini membutuhkan perlengkapan yang memadai untuk keselamatan mereka.

Selain tenaga medis, masih banyak kalangan yang merasakan dampak pandemi ini diantaranya mahasiswa/pelajar, pekerja, buruh, pedagang, dan masyarakat umum lainnya.

Maka dari itu, Direktorat Pengembangan Karir, Alumni dan Endowment (CAE) bekerjasama dengan Forum Alumni Universitas Telkom (FAST) mengajak teman-teman semua untuk bergerak dalam menebarkan kebaikan melalui donasi dalam program Edowment Peduli.

Program ini merupakan penggalangan donasi yang diperuntukan bagi saudara-saudara kita yang sedang terdampak pandemi Covid-19.

Bantuan bisa dalam bentuk :

Uang Tunai, Tabung Oksigen, Obat-obatan, Vitamin, Handsinitizer, Desinfektan, Paket Sembako dan Kebutuhan lainnya.

Mari kita bantu saudara-saudara kita dan membuat Indonesia segera pulih dari Pandemi Covid!

Donasi bisa melalui:

Bank Mandiri Syariah (BSI)

post_job_title: Final year student Industrial Engineering | Marketing | Business Analyst
post_description:
Hai teman-teman, saya Laveane H asal Banyuwangi dari Telkom University. Saya Bangga telah terpilih menjadi salah satu mentee MentorKU by Livingintelkom batch 1 2021

Kesan pertama mengikuti welcoming party kemarin saya merasakan eforia dan semangat yang tinggi tidak hanya dari teman-teman tetapi juga dari kaka-kaka mentor serta para buddy kampus update yang siap serta cekatan untuk menyusun acara secara rapi,baik,dan berkesan.

Pesan untuk kedepannya semoga program ini terus menjadi jembatan mahasiswa untuk create "purpose" nantinya. Semoga selalu kompak dan selalu semangat sampai akhir. Terus walaupun saling jauh dan belum ketemu semoga juga dilain kesempatan dapat bertemu dengan 250 orang keren yang punya semangat tinggi ini.

Selain bertemu juga menemukan insight baru yaitu "Real growth happens when you step out of comfort zone" yang bener-bener ada di dalam program ini. Kakak mentor yang sangat open banget dengan semangat kami para mentee-mentee lucu yang sangat siap dan semangat berprogress bersama. Also kaka buddy yang sangat membantu dalam proses tanya-tanya digroup tele, gercep, ramah dan juga friendly. You guys make positive vibes doping and also the spirit to be better day by day hehe luv you! <3

Dilansir dari halaman resmi www.webometrics.info. Telkom University kembali menempati peringkat pertama untuk PTS di Indonesia, sebagai perguruan tinggi dengan website terbaik.

Webometrics merupakan suatu sistem yang memberikan penilaian terhadap seluruh universitas terbaik di dunia melalui website yang dinilai berdasarkan keterbukaan akses, jumlah peneliti atau dosen, dan jumlah publikasi yang mengutip informasi dari situs universitas tersebut.
Saat ini webometrics merupakan pemeringkatan institusi pendidikan tinggi terbesar di dunia, dan informasi tentang performa dari universitas akan selalu diperbaharui setiap enam bulan. Saat ini Telkom University berada pada peringkat ke-7 di Indonesia dan menempati peringkat 1.376 dunia versi webometrics.
 
Terimakasih kepada seluruh sivitas akademika yang telah bekerja keras dalam mengharumkan nama Tel-U, ditengah pandemi ini semoga kita selalu diberikan kesehatan agar bisa terus mencetak generasi yang baik untuk bangsa ini.

post_job_title: | Research Associate at Gaznobay |Aspiring Mechanical Engineer| Process Safety Devotee | Project Management Enthusiast|
post_description:
It was surprising!

Sometimes you simply have to give an opportunity a fair shot; who knows what might be in it for you?

Thus, this year, I competed in the "Photography" category of Telkom University's International Creativity Competition 2021, where I won the 2nd prize. Woah! I was completely unprepared for this. However, it's satisfying to achieve an unexpected prize, isn't it?
When I learned about this competition, I thought to myself, "Wait a minute, this is an international competition, umm, but let me just register and submit some of my best photographs anyway." Yes, by the grace of Allah I won the 2nd prize. This is truly incredible! Because every accomplishment, no matter how small or large, is significant! For those who don't know , International Creativity Competition 2021 (arranged by Telkom University) has been held for all diplomas and Bachelor's degree students for any university, any major around the world with 90 participants registered.

I want to give special thanks to Telkom University and the respected judges of the photography segment of the competition. Kudos to all the participants of the competition because you gave it a shot and that's what it matters!

Keep me in your prayers.

Keep it up! Keep grinding!

post_job_title: Vice President of Asia Pacific & Japan at TigerGraph
post_description:
Indonesia is a country I am personally passionate about and today I am so happy to announce that Reza Pahlevi is joining TigerGraph to lead our team in country. We will create new jobs for Indonesia and we will bring value to the Indonesian economy. Gartner states that 80% of Analytics will be Graph based by 2025 and we will work with Indonesia to be one of the most competitive countries.

I was lucky to meet Reza when he was at Teradata and I was at Cloudera, we had the opportunity to deliver value for mutual clients. Now we reunite to bring value with TigerGraph. A few quick facts:

7 out of the 10 Global Banks use TigerGraph for a unique advantage with Fraud Prevention/Detection, AML, and KYC.

1.5 Billion mobile subscribers use TigerGraph for deep link analysis to find Telco Fraud and for Customer 360 Analytics.

20,000 Users from a global healthcare organization use TigerGraph to understand the next best patient recommendation in their call centers, resulting in savings of USD 150 million.

TigerGraph will continue to deliver value for our ASEAN clients & partners as they continue on their digital journeys. This requires the analysis of the connected relationships within their Data >>>and this is where TigerGraph and the Enterprise Graph Database enters the picture.

post_job_title: IT Department - Website Team Member at Lokerbee.ID
post_description:
6th semester done, well I think this was the time I push myself, especially in competition. just a few semesters more before I graduate so at least I try to improve myself as much as I can as a student not only in university courses. 

The journey started as 1st Winner at Campaign Video Event in my faculty, don't expect that one because I do not have very good editing skills in making video, but with support from my friends Naufal Rahmadaffa Ariekananda and Fakhri Hassan Maulana, we can achieve that. 

I also do many Competitive Programming events with EDE Laboratory and Just Code It Community members, we begin with Arkavidia 7.0, JOINTS 2021, Quora Programming Challenge 2021, Kotakode Coding Competition, Shopee Code League 2021. I never win actually but I just love to join this type of competition. the sensation when solving the problem is something, hahaha. after this, Gemastik XIV and Compfest are waiting for us.

in this semester, I with my friend do join Intension (Industrial and Enterprise System Competition) organized by ENSYSe and ESS Laboratory - Telkom University with David William Da Costa and Luthfi Fitra Musyaffa. I never join this kind of competition, but we come out as finalists (Top 10). it's inspiring us when seeing other group ideas, really great experience there.

I do try Capture The Flag by EIM Laboratory with @Alfian Maulana Fardhan and Fakhri Hassan Maulana. sure I just wanna have fun and make few experiences in this field, and unexpectedly we got 3rd place.

I also join a few other competition like UI/UX with David William Da Costa and Muhammad Fakhrul Safitra, Marketing Strategies, and go on, but it's not really good haha.

that's my experience in the competition this semester, for young people (especially students) I think we need to use this chance to join many things that we can do, we never know if there's another field that fits us. I do believe I am not a good one, there are many people better than me. 

Be pleased if you wanna share your story in the comment. Thanks for reading my post, I hope there are positive things we can get from this post.

#programming #coding #competitiveprogramming #learning #experience #students #university

post_job_title: Pimpinan I DPA HMTT 2021 | AWS Cloud & Back-end Developer Scholarship 2021
post_description:
"Alhamdulillah", the first word that I said after reading this e-mail. Flashback to the moment when the first time I accepted to Bangkit Academy led by Google, Tokopedia, Gojek, & Traveloka 2021. This semester is the best semester that I ever had and also a memorable experience in my life! Being one of the 3000 participants is an honor to me. Thanks to Mr. Brian Pamukti as my supervisor at Telkom University, mas Adrianus Yoza Aprilio, kak Febria Roosita D., kak Mutiara Arumsari, etc. You're all awesome!

Yes, indeed, that I've got so many knowledge from Bangkit Academy led by Google, Tokopedia, Gojek, & Traveloka 2021. Start from the hard-skills like #pythonprogramming, #machinelearning, #deeplearning, #math, #data, and off course about the #informationtechnolog . While the soft-skills itself are about #criticalthinking, #leadership, #growthmindset, how to make a good CV, etc.

Above all, at the Bangkit 2021, I could find the true meaning of a friendship. It was about how we care and help each other. To me, programming is not an easy thing to be understood and when I asked for helps, they helped me like we've been together for a long time. We could reveal what the friendship and all this knowledge is about.

Thank you.

6 Keunggulan dan Manfaat Kamu Harus Daftar Program INKUBATOR STARTUP!

Inkubator Startup untuk mahasiswa adalah program yang didesain dan difasilitasi oleh Corporate Innovation Asia - CIAS dan bekerja sama oleh Kampus Merdeka Kemdikbud.

Program meluncurkan Start up dalam 6 bulan, senilai dengan 20SKS, tentunya bersertifikat dan online. Dibimbing oleh mentor profesional menggunakan beragam metode inovasi populer dunia seperti Design Thinking, Agile Development dan Business Model Canvas.

Dan ada 6 keunggulan dan manfaat lainnya yang akan kamu dapat jika terpilih dalam program ini. Simak selengkapnya pada gambar di bawah ini dan kunjungi link ini untuk mendaftar www.cias.co/kampus-merdeka

post_job_title: Communications Management | Former News Presenter & Radio Announcer
post_description:
“Belajar dari Pengalaman”.

Lekat sekali diingatan, ketika itu saya masih menempuh pendidikan dan ada seorang dosen yang mengajar mata kuliah “Dasar-Dasar Jurnalistik”.

Kelas beliau bagi saya sangat menarik, karena terlepas dari materi yang harus disampaikan ke mahasiswa, beliau selalu membanjiri kami semua dengan cerita pengalaman awal-awal merintis karir, jadi wartawan kepresidenan, hingga liputan ke berbagai negara.

Sesi diskusi pun selalu ‘hidup’, padahal kelasnya siang yang biasanya jam-jam ngantuk ya.

Dari situlah, saya akhirnya senang mempelajari sesuatu melalui pengalaman orang lain dan sebaliknya saya pun jadi suka berbagi ilmu lewat pengalaman.

Karena menurut saya, ilmu yang ada di buku mungkin bisa kita dibeli, tapi pengalaman orang lain tidak semua dibukukan.
______________________________________________________
Dan, such an honor beberapa bulan belakangan saya berkesempatan untuk mengisi ke kelas-kelas ini:

1. Introduction to Public Relations - BINUS University Malang
2. Event Management - Vokasi Universitas Brawijaya Malang
3. Komunikasi Bisnis - Telkom University Bandung

Terima kasih atas antusiasmenya, semoga bermanfaat dan selamat liburan semester semuanya!🤗

Dilansir dari halaman resmi www.webometrics.info. Telkom University kembali menempati peringkat pertama untuk PTS di Indonesia, sebagai perguruan tinggi dengan website terbaik.

Webometrics merupakan suatu sistem yang memberikan penilaian terhadap seluruh universitas terbaik di dunia melalui website yang dinilai berdasarkan keterbukaan akses, jumlah peneliti atau dosen, dan jumlah publikasi yang mengutip informasi dari situs universitas tersebut.
Saat ini webometrics merupakan pemeringkatan institusi pendidikan tinggi terbesar di dunia, dan informasi tentang performa dari universitas akan selalu diperbaharui setiap enam bulan. Saat ini Telkom University berada pada peringkat ke-7 di Indonesia dan menempati peringkat 1.376 dunia versi webometrics.
 
Terimakasih kepada seluruh sivitas akademika yang telah bekerja keras dalam mengharumkan nama Tel-U, ditengah pandemi ini semoga kita selalu diberikan kesehatan agar bisa terus mencetak generasi yang baik untuk bangsa ini.

#telkomuniversity #kampusswastaterbaik #creatingthefuture

Hai teman-teman, Aku Aura asal Yogyakarta dari Telkom University. Aku bangga telah terpilih menjadi salah satu mentee MentorKU by Livingintelkom batch 1 2021.

-Im so blessed, Alhamdulillah!-
After going through the processes of the MentorKU by Livingintelkom program, I am finally here becoming the part of 250 selected mentees from 2447 applicants. I am fully grateful for this awe-inspiring opportunity.
And If you ask me “what is your best day in this weekend?” I would say “Friday” Because on Friday I started my first day of being a mentee in MentorKU by joining welcoming day event held by Livingintelkom. It’s such an honor for me since the event is attended by Telkom Indonesia leaders, the inspiring mentors, and surely the awesome mentees. All the mentors and speakers are so welcoming us as a mentee and I can feel that highly passionate energy by all of the mentees including me. From the event I got an amazing insight from the speakers, it is like supporting us as the mentees to develop our skills both in hard and soft skills moreover it taught us that success can come from many ways if you make efforts on it and keep learning. I highlighted this from the insight “be prepared and more practicing”. So, the welcoming day runs fantastic and I can’t wait to join the next few weeks with the mentors and mentees (I bet it would be more fun and also more inspiring).

Sabtu, 26 Juni 2021 saya mendapatkan kesempatan menjadi moderator dalam webinar "Jarimu Harimaumu". Webinar ini diselenggarakan oleh mahasiswa Ilmu Komunikasi Telkom University Bandung.

Webinar ini memberi kesempatan untuk belajar bersama bagaimana beretika yang baik dalam menggunakan media sosial terutama bagi generasi z. Generasi Z atau generasi net merupakan generasi yang dalam perkembangan hidupnya selalu terhubung dengan dunia maya dan kemudahan teknologi yang ada.

[𝐒𝐡𝐢𝐟𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐡 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐛𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧]

Challenging might be the word that can describe these past six months. There were so many new things that challenges me, one of them is business competition.

Competition is one of the activities that I have participated in since childhood. I have participated in various math competitions at the regional, national, and even international levels. In addition to training my skills, competitions helped me in finding my personal branding. Not only that, competition also led me to become a high achiever, that is, someone who is ambitious, goal-focused, and disciplined to achieve his goals.

In my first year as an information systems student at the University of Indonesia, I participated various business competitions with Alfath Nuurlathif and Altito A.. These new experiences are quite challenging because none of us is an undergraduate business student. In the last few months, we have won 1st place in the UNJA SMART EXPO competition and finalists at ME UGM and JSI Telkom.

Thank you to various parties who have supported me. In the future, I hope to continue to maintain and improve my achievements before I graduate from FASILKOM University of Indonesia

Melalui laman https://lnkd.in/gh2yrxN, Times Higher Education (THE) merilis daftar THE Young University Rankings 2021. Data pemeringkatan ini merangkum daftar universitas terbaik dunia yang berusia kurang dari atau 50 tahun dan didirikan antara tahun 1971 hingga 2021.

Dari 475 universitas di 68 negara dan wilayah yang disaring THE, Telkom University menjadi satu-satunya perguruan tinggi di Indonesia yang masuk dalam daftar THE Young University Rankings 2021 dan menduduki peringkat 401+ dalam daftar tersebut.

Pemeringkatan THE Young University Rankings 2021 disusun berdasarkan Indikator kinerja universitas ke dalam lima area, yaitu teaching (lingkungan belajar), research (volume, income, dan reputasi), citations (pengaruh riset); international outlook (staf, mahasiswa, dan riset), serta industry income (knowledge transfer).
Pada indikator tersebut, Telkom University mencapai skor teaching 17.1, research 12.6, citations 22.2, international outlook 15.5, serta industry income 33.8.

Terima kasih kepada seluruh Sivitas Akademika Telkom University yang telah berkontribusi pada pencapaian ini. Semoga Telkom University dapat terus menjadi yang terbaik dan mengharumkan nama Indonesia di mata dunia.

#telkomuniversity #kampusswastaterbaik #creatingthefuture

[Prodi D3 Teknologi Komputer, Fakultas Ilmu Terapan, Telkom University - Akreditasi UNGGUL]

Alhamdulillah Prodi D3 Teknologi Komputer menjadi program studi vokasi pertama di Fakultas Ilmu Terapan dan juga prodi D3 Teknologi Komputer pertama di Indonesia yang terakreditasi Unggul. Selain itu Prodi D3 Teknologi Komputer menjadi prodi Diploma III pertama di LLDIKTI Wilayah IV yang terakreditasi Unggul untuk Perguruan Tinggi Swasta. Tel-U Satu-Satunya Kampus di Indonesia yang masuk THE Young University Rankings 2021

Lembaga pemeringkatan kampus dunia, Times Higher Education (THE) kembali merilis daftar THE Young University Rankings 2021 berdasarkan rentang usia universitas kurang dari atau 50 tahun.

Melalui laman resmi timeshighereducation, daftar THE Young University Rankings 2021 mencakup perguruan tinggi terbaik dunia yang didirikan antara tahun 1971 hingga 2021, dan pada tahun ini mencakup 475 universitas dari seluruh dunia.

Dari 475 perguruan tinggi dunia yang berasal dari 68 negara, Telkom University (Tel-U) menjadi satu-satunya perguruan tinggi di Indonesia yang masuk ke dalam daftar peringkat THE Young University Ranking 2021, di mana Tel-U berhasil menempati peringkat 401+.

I'm thrilled after 3.5 years graduating from Telkom University as Sarjana Teknik Industri (Bachelor of Industrial Engineering) and spend 1.5 years on job-seeking. I am ecstatic to announce that I will be a Buyer (Part of Supply Chain Team) at one of the Schneider Electric's Global Factory in Batam, Indonesia.

I want to say thank you to all the people who helped me in Telkom University especially to my beloved mentor Prafajar Suksesanno Muttaqin. And of course i would like to express my gratitude to Zanuar Galang Bewana, Jan Aytona, Dinny D., and Rosy Mentang for helping me through all the recruitment process stages.

This is Agætis Byrjun for me. Life is On!

When I was working at Telkom I came across a bunch of books that were thrown away by a cleaner from the office of a retired manager, then when I check they were several copies of Wits business journals he subscribed for and they were always delivered even though he was not there anymore.

As hungry as I was for an academic knowledge I took my time to hear what these journals were all about, I took them home and had time to read though. That day was my lucky because those journals inspired me to work on what I left unfinished after one of my colleagues from other employer told my supervisor that I'm studying Management program, then the supervisor tried so hard to expell me so I'll fail to pay for my studies.

However these journals were narrative with successful stories of leaders within big brands who enrolled for different Management courses at Wits mostly for MBA and followed their dreams with courage and made it possible some from lower levels of their careers.AS FROM THAT DAY MY MINDSET CHANGED, I EMBRACED CHALLENGES AND SCALED THEM AS OPPORTUNITIES.

1. If I ask for an opportunity I automatically mean a need to be a role player or a change factor in business processes

2. A need to expand the know how initiative in a minimal time and reinvest that particular knowledge for efficiency and effectiveness.

I'm so excited that soon I'll be a graduate at the end of this year from Durban University of Technology in Management, majoring in Business law and Management. The question of "WHAT DO YOU KNOW" is soon to be answered and above all I would like to honor Imvula Quality Protection for recruiting me in 2010 which is a decision exposed me to Telkom and MTN both companies which became the landscape and the source of all my motivations to study further.

Learning is continuous and it is limited by no circumstances, WITS BUSINESS JOURNAL #leaders

Sebagai PTS terbaik, Telkom University kembali menorehkan prestasi membanggakan dipertengahan tahun 2021 ini.

Quacquarelli Symonds (QS) World University Rankings (WUR) 2022 merilis bahwa Telkom University meraih overall score di angka 8.1. Hal ini menjadikan Tel-U masuk dalam Top 10 perguruan tinggi unggulan di Indonesia.

Sebagai informasi, QS merupakan merupakan lembaga pemeringkat universitas Dunia yang berbasis di London, Inggris, menggunakan penilaian berdasarkan sistem evaluasi rating terkait inovasi, keterbukaan, layanan pendidikan yang meliputi penelitian dan pengajaran, kebermanfaatan terhadap masyarakat sekitar (community service) dan terkait dukungan sumber daya.

Terima kasih kepada #TelUtizen yang telah berkontribusi pada prestasi ini. Semoga Telkom University dapat terus menjadi yang terbaik di tingkat Nasional maupun tingkat Internasional.

Telkom University menjadi kampus pertama di Indonesia yang didukung oleh jaringan 5G dari Telkomsel.

Kehadiran Telkomsel 5G di wilayah Bandung khususnya di Telkom University diharapkan dapat membuka lebih banyak peluang riset pengembangan inovasi pemanfaatan teknologi 5G yang tepat guna sehingga dapat menjadikan masyarakat Indonesia sebagai smart digitalpreneur yang dapat mendorong transformasi Indonesia menuju kedaulatan dan kemandirian digital yang utuh.

Selain itu telah dilakukan penandatanganan nota kesepahaman antara Telkomsel dan Telkom University untuk melakukan riset tentang teknologi 5G, mengakselerasikan upaya pemanfaatan dan pengembangan 5G beserta ekosistemnya, sekaligus mendorong lahirnya talenta digital masa depan yang mampu mewujudkan kemandirian digital bangsa.

UBL BOARD APPOINTMENTS:
Jane Karuku has been admitted to the Uganda Breweries Limited Board as a non-executive director.
Jane is the current Group Managing Director and CEO of East African Breweries Ltd Limited. She replaces Andrew Cowan, the former EABL CEO who got appointed by Diageo, the EABL parent company, as the Managing Director, Diageo Africa Regional Markets.
Jane was previously the Managing Director of Kenya Breweries Limited (KBL) since July 2015. She is a dynamic business leader, with strong management experience spanning over 20 years in FMCG and Non-Governmental Organizations.
Before her appointment to KBL, Jane was the President of Alliance for a Green Revolution in Africa (AGRA). She has also previously held several senior positions in various companies including Deputy Chief Executive and Secretary-General, Telkom Kenya and Managing Director, Cadbury East and Central Africa. Prior to that Ms Karuku worked with Farmers Choice Kenya and Kenya Cooperative Creameries.
She has been a member of the Board of Barclays Bank of Kenya (now Absa Bank Kenya) and Junior Achievement-Kenya. She is currently the Chairperson of the Kenya Covid-19 Fund, Chairperson of Kenya’s Vision 2030 Board, a Trustee at the United States International University - Africa and is a Board member at Kenya Association of Manufacturers.
Jane holds a Bachelor of Science Degree in Food Science and Technology from the University of Nairobi and an MBA in Marketing from the National University of California.

post_job_title: Editor in Chief at Students Tel-U (Telkom University Online News Portal I News Reporter at IKOM CHANNEL I Communication Science Student at Telkom University
post_description:
[Winning The Best Abstract in Academic Creation Essay Competition 2021]

A few days ago I received a special package from my beloved Campus, Telkom University. Receiving this package felt much happier than receiving another package as usual. The package is a plaque as the winner of the 2021 Academic Creation Essay Competition (ACE Competition).

Academic Creation Essay (ACE) is an event created with the concept of a research planning abstract writing competition followed by a three-minute presentation of scientific papers. This event has the theme “Synchronization of Ideas Through Communication”. This competition was initiated by students of the Communication Study Program under the guidance of lecturer Mr. Arie Prasetio, S.Sos., M.Si in early 2021, and became the first scientific work competition event within the scope of the Communication Studies Program at Telkom University.

In this competition, I won the first place in the best abstract category. It is an honor for me to receive this award. I hope this reward will make me more excited to complete my thesis proposal in this semester.

In this competition, I was previously selected to be a participant after being selected by my lecturer through a class-level selection process based on the results of the mid-semester exam scores in Academic Writing Subject. 

After that, I made an abstract of the research based on my thesis proposal, which entitled "Communication Strategy Conducted by Buleleng Tourism Government to Promoting "Janger Kolok" in Pandemic Covid-19 Era". This research was motivated by decreasing phenomena in “Janger Kolok” performances because of the restrictions on all activities including the tourism sector in this pandemic situation. So, I hope with this research, several policies will be realized as a communication strategy by Buleleng Tourism Government to restore the tourism sector in Bali, especially “Janger Kolok” as the one of unique cultural tours and just only one in Buleleng Bali.

For more information about this ACE competition, you can read on the following link:

https://lnkd.in/dyS7aHP

https://lnkd.in/dfXMbST

#ACE2021 #academicreationessay #academicwritingcompetition #scientificwriting

post_description:
#Mzansi is a land full of opportunity for those few individuals who choose to dream big and put in the hard work.

I was born in #Soweto, spent childhood in deep rural #Mpumalanga, in a small village named kwa-Tshabalala (because everyone there had a last name Tshabalala thanks to my grandfather and his extended family deciding to escape racist white farms to start a new life in harsh remote mountains closer to Swaziland).

Family later moved to a place called eLukwatini at some point where I attended both primary and high school. Never paid a single cent for school thanks to the government’s free education policy for struggling communities...this was so good we even had free meals at school (including free vaccinations) because the government cared and understood our community struggles.

Life in the late 80s and early 90s was super interesting politically as one moment you were toy-toying on the streets, chased by police and all that...the next moment you were super focused devouring every government provided school textbook getting ready to be useful in the new South Africa.

Telkom was a good surprise, out of nowhere they decided to fund my entire university tuition, accommodation etc. They even gave me my first job even though I tried everything not to work for them (like attending interview with an old free t-shirt, flip flops and shots).

Fast track a few years later, I am this super awesome, highly educated, super creative, self starter, community developer, digital nomad and super high energy game changer!

Guess what...I could be a damn failure today and use politics, racism etc. as a perfect excuse!

Lesson: Don’t ever be a victim in any difficult situation, turn lemon to lemonade...excuses suck, and they generally reward you with a life of misery.

South Africa is really an awesome country and a place where it is possible if you put in the hard work every time you dream big!

Photo: Got a chance to take a picture a few years ago with my science teacher during a visit with LadyBug Foundation. I never left the community and we continue to change lives through the foundation.

Keep dreaming and #BeThatChange!

post_job_title: Division B Public Relations Assistant at Toastmasters International
post_description:
Hari ini saya diberi kesempatan berharga untuk bisa memberikan materi dan ikut berdiskusi dengan teman saya di Aksara Jurnalistik Telkom University mengenai public speaking. Meskipun kita berasal dari beragam jurusan yang berbeda, namun public speaking tetap hal yang perlu dikuasai siapapun.

Sama seperti pepatah yang mengatakan bahwa bakat itu tidak terlahir, tapi dilatih, menjadi public speaker yang baik juga begitu. Tidak mungkin seseorang handal berbicara tanpa berlatih mengeja terlebih dahulu.

Belajar untuk berbicara di depan publik juga tidak harus dimulai dengan menjadi pemateri atau pembicara, terkadang cukup memberanikan diri bertanya di kelas atau seminar juga lebih dari cukup. Setelah menjadi kebisaan, kepercayaan diri juga akan ikut terbangun.

#publicspeaking #university

CALL FOR PAPERS
The 4th International Conference on Industrial, Enterprise, and System Engineering (ICoIESE) 2021
"Collaboration of Science, Technology and Innovation Toward Sustainable Development"

Online conference (with an on-site possibility), December 16, 2021

Keynote Speaker:
Dr. Maria Eugenia Jacob (Professor, University of Twente - Netherland)
Dr. Erween Bin Abd Rahim (Professor, Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia)

IMPORTANT DEADLINES
---------------------------------
Full Paper Submission: May 29th, 2021
Full Paper Submission (extended): June 25th, 2021
Acceptance Notification: July 30th, 2021
Conference Date: December 16th, 2021

The conference aims to gather practitioners and researchers who interested in science, technology development and innovation to share ideas, experiences, and knowledge for the scientific contribution.

Tracks (but not limited to):
• Industrial and Manufacturing System,
• Manufacturing and Materials Engineering,
• Innovation in Integrated Engineering, and
• ICT, Software and Hardware Engineering.

Manuscript Preparation
Author must use AIP template, which can be downloaded from https://lnkd.in/gAsPQjM
The minimum length of the manuscript is 4 pages (including Background, Methods, Results and Discussion, Conclusion, Acknowledgements, References).

Full paper submission: https://lnkd.in/geVPyyk

All accepted and presented papers will be published in AIP Conference Proceedings (Indexed in Scopus and Web of Science)

For more information, please kindly visit
https://icoiese.id
info.icoiese@gmail.com

Looking forward to meeting you online in December 2021!

On behalf of ICoIESE 2021 Committee

Dino Caesaron, Ph.D
General Chair ICoIESE 2021

Sharing in webinar organized by Girls Force Telkom University with 120 sign-up participants, about “How to Kick Start Your Carrier at a Startup”.

post_job_title: Marketing and Business Development, Indonesia Representative, Space Bridge Inc and AQST Inc, Canada
post_description:
International Class of UGM and UiTM

It was a very delighted moment when Bang Teuku Muda Nanta and I collaborated to share our experiences in dealing with projects at PT. Telekomunikasi Indonesia.

We were invited by DR. Azhari, MT, Head of Computer Science Program of FMIPA-UGM. The topic was Management Model and Project Management in Telecommunication Industry. I presented The Introduction of Satellite Industry with the study cases: "Telkom Satellite Procurement" and also "Managing the Operation and Business of Satellites" , while Bang Nanta presented Project Business Management of PT. Telkom. Both classes took 2 hours and 30 minutes including Q&A.

That was an international class which was a collaboration between University of Gajah Mada (UGM) and University of Teknologi Mara (UiTM) Malaysia. It was attended by around 60 students, DR. Azhari, MT, Prof. Datin DR. Noor Habibah Arsyad and another Associate Professor.

Hopefully, our knowledge and experiences sharing was fruitful and beneficial to all the students and participants.

My gratitude to DR. Azhari, MT for his invitation.
Rekrutmen Dosen Telkom University Tahun 2021 | Informasi selengkapnya dapat dilihat melalui: https://lnkd.in/gg4Cm2Q

After receiving a permit from the Communications and Information Ministry on May 24, Telkomsel has officially launched its Telkomsel 5G service, becoming the first cellular operator to offer 5G in Indonesia.
The launch is an important milestone for the company, which marked its 26th anniversary on May 26.
Telkomsel’s 5G service, introduced with the theme “5G: Unlock the Future”, is now available for commercial use in key areas across nine cities in its first phase, which includes the Telkomsel Smart Office and a number of residential areas in Jakarta, Solo City Hall, Telkom University and the Bandung Institute of Technology, as well as several GraPARI locations in Surabaya, Makassar, Bali, Batam, Medan, Solo, Balikpapan and Soekarno-Hatta International Airport.
#telcoindustry #technology #5g #indonesia #future #innovation #telecommunications #Proud Telkomsel

post_job_title: Tel-U Marketing Communication student | Ex-Head of Mentor @ABILITAS ID | Social Project Enthusiast
post_description:
Hi, I want to share my experience in joining PILMAPRES (Pemilihan Mahasiswa Berprestasi) that is conducted by Universitas Telkom. It is measured by Academic and Non-Academic Achievements.

Since before I went to college which 2 years ago, I prepared myself that I would join PILMAPRES in the future, one of the most prestigious awards in every university. Little do you know, 2 years later which is this month, I finally get what I've been wanting.

On May 4, a day before the registration closed, I completed the files and papers for the registration of the Faculty Level of PILMAPRES. On May 7, I was contacted by the faculty staff that I was selected as the Faculty of Communication and Business' Most Outstanding Student based on my Academic and Non-Academic Achievements that I submitted and continued to follow the university level selection. Currently, I and the other 8 candidates from other faculties have passed 2 stages at the university level, namely papers & interviews. currently, we are on our orientation by participating in soft skills and personality training.

Next week the top 3 will be selected and return with the election of 1 person who will represent the campus at the regional and national levels. Wish Me Luck!
#PILMAPRES #OutstandingStudent #TelkomUniversity

Hello, everyone!
I would like to share my experience as Community Ambassador or LYCDP (Lingkaran Youth Community Development Program) Batch 6 of lingkaran. It was such a great opportunity for me being a part of this startup which focuses on digital marketing field.

In the past 3 months (February-April 2021), I had to work on three different divisions. I worked on Marketing division in February. I was responsible for creating article entitled “Memilih Kursus Online yang Tepat? Simak 5 Tips Berikut Ini!” (https://lnkd.in/eb7b4CV)

In March, working on Community and Partnership division was offered to me. I was successful making deal with 5 communities (UKM Pengabdian Masyarakat USD, Rekan Aktif, Gores Denai, Central Computer Improvement Telkom University, and Nukeytalks).

The opportunity being one of the Operation team was approached to me in April. I was the moderator for SEO 101 class (WNTT) with Bayu Aditya Suryanto as the mentor, Customer Journey (Mini Class) with Tessa Viennie, Building Social Media for Your Own Business (Prakerja Class) with Andreas Gandhi Hendra Pratama as the mentor, and so on.

I was nominated as the best LYCDP 6 as the result of my hard work. Hence, I am very grateful for being given the new insight and experience by lingkaran.

[INFORMASI BEASISWA]

Telah dibuka pendaftaran Beasiswa Paragon Scholarship 2021.

Persyaratan :

Beasiswa Prestasi
1. Mahasiswa minimal D3 hingga S1 tahun ke 2 per Agustus 2021 di kampus terpilih (angkatan tahun masuk 2020)
2. IPK > 3.3
3. Direkomendasikan oleh pihak universitas konteks finansial
4. Tidak sedang menerima beasiswa lain
5. Bersedia untuk menjadi agent Paragon untuk kampusnya

Beasiswa Inovasi (Tugas Akhir)
1. Mahasiswa tahun ke-4 per Agustus 2021 (Angkatan Tahun Masuk 2018/2019) kampus UI, UGM, ITB, UNPAD, UB, UNDIP, IPB, Telkom University, ITS
2. IPK > 3.3
3. Tidak sedang menerima beasiswa lain
4. Bersedia untuk menjadi agent (perpanjangan tangan) Paragon untuk kampusnya
5. Berkomitmen untuk mengikuti seluruh program Paragon Scholarship
6. Proposal penelitian yang diajukan aligned dengan kebutuhan perusahaan dengan tema tertentu
7. Penelitian sifatnya dapat diselesaikan dalam waktu 1 tahun (2 semester)
8. Berkomitmen untuk mengikuti tes seleksi karyawan setelah program selesai

post_description:
The theme of change. Change is inevitable in all life dimensions.
I don't know why I resonate much with this fact.
The very moment the C-19 pandemic hit, the world was forced to align to the changes.
Who even thought, that at a point we'll all wear masks like surgeons 🤣, actually the only difference is that that we don't posses the surgical skills, otherwise we're all doctors from the looks.

The changes injected Teleconferencing, Telecommuting, Telemedicine, name it all, into the system and that's the new normal. We've embraced the change for sustainability.

Now let me narrow to my audience, students.
Online learning became a litmus test to most higher learning institutions. Others embraced the change on time and succeed, others failed terribly.
I want to laud University of Nairobi , partnered with Telkom and fully supported their students in online learning, completed semesters and held graduation. In other institutions, fee not subsidized, online learning fully at the students cost, it proved futile. The idea failed terribly and the institutions says absolutely nothing about it.
Take a look at the syllabus, in the 21st century, a professor walks in with notes he used in his undergraduate studies in the 18th century. "we uliskia wapi".

#education
#changeforbetter

post_job_title: Digital Financial Services Specialist, Africa Digital Financial Inclusion Facility, African Development Bank Group
post_description: Financial and digital literacy issues at the heart of Nairobi – In December 2020 I was at Huduma Centre next to the Polytechnic University accessing government services. After a long queue, the lady at the counter announces there is an additional fee payable only via M-Pesa. Instructions are pasted on the wall. Whoever finishes, is served. I sigh, queue is broken. I pay and access the service. As I turn to leave, I am stopped by about 60 people, who need support. The questions – how do I sign up for M-Pesa? How do I use M-Pesa? Is Airtel and Tala same as M-Pesa? Why can’t I pay via Telkom? What is a paybill? Till number? What’s the difference between Fuliza, M-Shwari, Branch and Tala? How do I space when typing? How do I search for information on google? How do I generate and track a reference number? I don’t have M-Pesa, can I pay you double so you pay on my behalf? I patiently show them the steps and the queue increases. It’s now about 200 people waiting to be supported. I have another commitment. So I nominate the fast learners to continue the process. As I depart, I hear one brag, “Let me show you. You see. I was born digital. Literally with a phone in my hand. This is so easy” I turn to look at him and he smiles. I shake my head and laugh – a seed has been planted.

post_job_title: UI/UX Designer at Telkom DDB | Co-Founder & Chief Product Officer at HayLingo | Final Year Student at Telkom University
post_description:
"Just Do It", a quote from a famous brand that I would never imagine would change how I see things in a scope of career-work. Every chances that I've encountered and took had been insightful and life-changing, it changed my past life of living deep inside of my own "comfort zone" without any resolve to try anything new. But this year, it all changed after I finished Telkom's Digital Talent Incubator's (DTI) Apprenticeship Program with the role of being a UI/UX Designer.

Many thanks to everyone responsible for the creation of this program and everyone that had worked alongside me to achieve something out of my own comfort zone, this including the cooperation between Telkom University and Telkom Indonesia for making this program and allowing other final year students and/or fresh graduates to explore and improve upon their skills in their desired roles that they chose.

Now, I've been able to work more efficiently in many sectors of UI/UX designs and I'm currently working as an internship worker with on-going design side - projects aswell as contributing towards my startups.

If you're being presented with an opportunity to be a better version of yourself in the future, go get that opportunity. The same opportunity ain't going to come twice in the future

Cheers!

Hari ini tiba-tiba saya jadi teringat kalau saya punya foto yang menjadi bukti saya pernah mendapatkan beasiswa selama saya berkuliah di Telkom University. Waktu itu saya masih terbilang mahasiswa baru, kalau tidak salah saat itu tahun 2017 awal. Saya mendapatkan Beasiswa Bawaku Kota Bandung yang diberikan oleh Dinas Pendidikan Kota Bandung. Awalnya saya ragu bisa mendapatkan beasiswa itu, tapi ternyata saya mendapatkan manfaat beasiswa itu hingga 3 tahun berkuliah. Ada suatu kebanggaan bagi saya karena mengingat waktu itu pendaftarnya cukup banyak bahkan ribuan dari mahasiswa Telkom saat itu, namun dengan motivasi saya mampu mendapatkan beasiswa di tahun pertama, menjadi acuan untuk di tahun ke 2 bahkan ke 3 saat saya berkuliah.

Dengan adanya cerita saya pernah mendapatkan beasiswa ini, menurut saya bukan jadi suatu penghalang jika kita tidak bisa mendapatkan beasiswa terlebih di kampus ternama, pasti selalu ada jalan dan ada kesempatannya untuk mendapatkan beasiswa dalam bentuk apapun itu.

#telkomuniversity #beasiswabawaku #beasiswa #motivasi

Sedikit sharing.

Sebelumnya mau bilang Terimakasih untuk Telkom Indonesia dan Telkom University yang mau memfasilitasi kegiatan Digital Talent Incubator (DTI) yang merupakan kerjasama antara Tel-U dengan Telkom Indonesia.

Setelah kemarin sempet magang di DDB Telkom, akhirnya kemarin nyobain ikut DTI Telkom juga. Seneng bgt bisa banyak belajar lagi, diri ini harus melawan rasa males atau kegabutan yang dirasa setelah selesai yudisium kemarin, dan dapat kesempatan untuk belajar skill baru khususnya Scrum Master. Alhamdulillah selama prosesnya selalu fun setiap kelas pembelajarannya, +- 3 bulan belajar tentang Scrum, Agile, dll. Semoga bisa semakin banyak kesempatan atau program seperti ini untuk Fresh Graduate dan Adek-adek di tingkat akhir untuk jadi bekal pembelajaran serta pengalaman bagi mereka.

Diakhir DTI ini fokusnya pada pembuatan Project Akhir. Saya bersama Tim membuat usulan project PindahinAja! yang akan saya jelaskan di next postingan setelah ini.

Intinya, saya terimakasih untuk kesempatan yang diberikan dan maksih juga untuk my team selama project DTI ini Rizka Fadhilah dan Chairul Vikri yang selalu jd support system juga selama DTI.

Sampai berjumpa di next project, semoga kita bs disatukan kembali nantinyaa dikerjaan sesungguhnya ya! Rizka Fadhilah Chairul Vikri

Yuhuu, sharing hasil belajar…

Saya muridnya Mas Andrew Prasatya. Beberapa waktu lalu dapat tugas bikin Content Marketing. Harus berperan seolah-olah menjadi Content Marketing Specialist-nya RevoU.

Tugasnya meliputi memikirkan ide konten yang berhubungan dengan core business RevoU, lalu cara mendapatkan datanya, distribusi strateginya, hingga membuat kontennya.

aha! Dapat ide konten simple. Saya ingin mengetahui; Universitas di Indonesia mana yang alumninya paling banyak terserap oleh 5 eCommerce terbesar di Indonesia.

Short term data dari iprice group untuk 5 eCommerce terbesar di Indonesia Q4 2020, dan dari LinkedIn untuk mendapatkan education background dari staff di Shopee, Tokopedia, Bukalapak, Lazada, dan Blibli.com.

From September 2020 - December 2020 I have joined Digital Talent Incubation as Data Scientist Talent held by Telkom University, Tel-U Career, and Telkom Indonesia. It was such a great opportunity to learn a lot of things about data science from mentors and also fellow participants.

During this program, I met new friends and make a good friendship here. we had some discussions, we had some jokes, and having fun too.

Such a pleasure to work with Rachma Indira and Deva Hidayat for the final task. You guys really supportive and very reliable. We also want to say thank you to our mentor Mr. Muhammad Apriandito Arya Saputra . He is so fun and really support us from the begining. For the final task we made a website that could predict a persons's eligibility to receive a loan or not.

Thank you Tel-U Career and Telkom Indonesia for this opportunity.

This app was built in order to increase time efficiency when attendee filled the attendant list, in their previous event, attendance input take such a long time because attendee should search their name manually on website and click to input their name in attendee list and make a long queue at gate.

I use Java as Android Frontend, and Google Spreadsheet for save the attendee list , and user google script to connect between spreadsheet and android app.

Teruntuk adik adik tercinta generasi penerus bangsa.

Tidak banyak yang bisa Kak Suci tunjukkan tentang sebuah pencapaian dalam bentuk nominal rupiah ataupun dollar.

Kak Suci juga bukanlah seseorang yang bergelar besar, tapi impian Kk yang besar yang menjadi fondasi pijakan kaki kk untuk menjadi orang besar, berfikir besar, berjiwa besar dan berpendapatan besar.

Adik - adikku...

Kak Suci hanya bisa berbagi kepada adik adik tentang bagaimana mempunyai pola pikir menjadi seorang pengusaha saat masih kuliah, saat masih seorang karyawan, atau saat tak tau arah yang mau dituju.

Bagaimana menemukan kekuatan terbesar didalam dirimu dan menjadikan itu sebagai peta awal melangkahkan pijakanmu menuju impianmu.

Mentalitasmu akan mendukungmu menjadi seseorang yang tangguh dalam mengarungi tajamnya lika liku perjalanan hidupmu.

Semoga sedikit pengalaman ini menjadi secercah cahaya untuk adik adik sekalian.

Terima kasih yang tak terhingga kepada Bp. Sutardi dan seluruh jajaran pengurus Telkom University bidang Kewirausahaan yang telah memberikan kepercayaan dan kesempatan yang luar biasa untuk saya berbagi dengan adik - adik tercinta.

Thanks to Allah
Thanks to you all

Warm hug

Suci W

Telkom University berhasil menjadi Perguruan Tinggi Swasta (PTS) Terbaik No.1 di Indonesia dalam Pemeringkatan Times Higher Education (THE) Impact Rankings 2021.

Secara keseluruhan Telkom University berada pada peringkat ke-10 di Indonesia bersanding dengan Perguruan Tinggi Negeri (PTN) terbaik. Sedangkan untuk dunia, Telkom University menduduki peringkat ke 201-300.

Mengutip laman resmi https://lnkd.in/dYssVhh, pada pemeringkatan ini THE WUR memberikan pemeringkatan kepada 1.115 perguruan tinggi dari 94 negara berdasarkan Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) yang ditentukan oleh Perserikatan Bangsa-Bangsa (PBB).

Terdapat empat aspek penilaian THE Impact Rangkings, yakni Research (Penelitian), Teaching (Pengajaran), Stewardship (Pengelolaan), dan Outreach (Pengabdian).

Kita semua berbangga untuk pencapaian ini. #TelUProud #TelUtizenProud
